ygData.subject: Re: Welcome to EQ_women@onelist.com
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I thought it meant soldier .. but then, my spanish isn t very good I guess. Still, the word sounds neat. gwear-EEEEEEEE-ya. (Why else learn a language
ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 25 Jun 1999 14:26:54 Laura Chris Green, Ph.D. wrote:
>From: "Laura Chris Green, Ph.D." <cgreen@...>
> Guerilla has a double meaning, Literally it means small war, but it also

I thought it meant "soldier".. but then, my spanish isn't very good I guess. Still, the word sounds neat. gwear-EEEEEEEE-ya. (Why else learn a language except becuase it sounds neat? Japanese is next. =)

> I love role playing games because they remind me of the legends and fairy
>tales I passionately devoured as a child. EQ is the first one I've played

Me too! I grew up to tales of mythology. I drank them like a thirsty woman drinks water (or like a Dark Elf Necromancer drinks blood)

>capabilities. Also, sometimes I know the answer to questions and problems
>but some, (not all) male characters do not listen well to me because they
>do not expect me to know. Just like real life, huh, sisters?

No doubt!

>them, "I'm too old for you. Just call me mom." Most reply ROFL and we go
>on.

I do that too! and I'm only 30! Still, if I had gotten preggers when many of my classmates had, I COULD have been Mom to some of them!

> Do you, the rest of my sisters, get regular questions about your age and
>marital status? What do you reply? The truth, a lie, none of your business?
>Interested in hearing how you deal with the issue.

I usually tell the truth. I'm a 30yr old Single Geek Chick. Sometimes I even send them to my web page. (http://www.best.com/~mash)

My age discourages most flirting though, except by the older men, most of whom are taken.

Pix/Shalka/Kiowa/Megan
